abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic and Financial Management
            Project in Honduras, will improve the use, and allocation of
            public resources, develop budgetary plans, and evaluation
            capacity in government agencies, and promote institutional
            restructuring within the telecommunications, ports, and
            postal services sectors. The components will: 1) strengthen
            the Secretariat of Finance, and in line Secretariats, in
            support of the integrated financial management system
            (SIAFI), which will operate in budget, treasury, accounting,
            and public credit areas. Legal framework will be enhanced,
            and an organizational restructuring will take place; 2)
            modernize audit institutions, and provide technical
            assistance to the Office of the Comptroller General, through
            institutional strengthening, civil society's
            participation, and comprehensive training programs; 3)
            develop human resources management policies, through
            technical assistance, and training; 4) support the
            development of performance-oriented management, and
            evaluation capacity in the public sector; 5) increase the
            efficiency of public procurement, through technical
            assistance, and training regarding the new public
            procurement information system, and strengthen regulatory,
            and institutional framework; and, 6) consolidate regulatory
            reforms within the telecommunications, ports, and postal
            services, assisting in the privatization process, and
            restructuring strategies.
